summary: The Choose Medicare Act proposes the establishment of Medicare Part E plans, available in individual, small group, and large group markets, offering gold-level coverage including essential health benefits, Part XVIII coverage, and abortion/reproductive services. It addresses eligibility, premiums, provider reimbursement, and alternative payment models. The bill also includes provisions for employer-sponsored plans, navigator referrals under the Fair Labor Standards Act, protection against high out-of-pocket costs, and enhancements to premium assistance and cost-sharing reductions. Additionally, it provides for a reinsurance and affordability fund and expands rating rules.
